dt: {bc}a cylindrical device which has a rim or ridge at each end and an axial hole for a pin or spindle and on which material (such as thread, wire, or tape) is wound
{bc}material or the amount of material wound on a spool

et: Middle English {it}spole{/it}, from Middle Dutch {it}spoele{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}spuola{/it} spool
shortdef: a cylindrical device which has a rim or ridge at each end and an axial hole for a pin or spindle and on which material (such as thread, wire, or tape) is wound
material or the amount of material wound on a spool

dt: {bc}to regulate the transmission of by means of a {a_link|spooler}
{bc}to regulate data flow by means of a spooler

shortdef: to regulate the transmission of by means of a spooler
